results.title: Metformin-induced E6/E7 inhibition prevents HPV-positive cancer progression through p53 reactivation.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@-induced E6/E7 inhibition prevents @<m>DISEASE_Papillomavirus_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D030361 @@@HPV-positive cancer@@@ progression through @GENE_TP53 @GENE_7157 @@@p53@@@ reactivation.

citations.NLM: Zhang R, Hou F, Gan J, Zhang L, Yang D, Yang F, Xia X, Chen Q, Bian C, Feng X. Metformin-induced E6/E7 inhibition prevents HPV-positive cancer progression through p53 reactivation. Anticancer Drugs. 2025 Mar 18;():. PMID: 40100964

results.title: Effects of Metformin on the virus/host cell crosstalk in human papillomavirus-positive cancer cells.
results.text_hl: Moreover, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ treatment enables @<m>DISEASE_Papillomavirus_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D030361 @@@HPV-positive@@@ @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@cancer@@@ cells to escape from chemotherapy-induced senescence.

citations.NLM: Hoppe-Seyler K, Herrmann AL, Däschle A, Kuhn BJ, Strobel TD, Lohrey C, Bulkescher J, Krijgsveld J, Hoppe-Seyler F. Effects of Metformin on the virus/host cell crosstalk in human papillomavirus-positive cancer cells. Int J Cancer. 2021 Sep 1;149(5):1137-1149. PMID: 33844847

results.title: Metformin use and the risk of anal intraepithelial neoplasia in type II diabetic patients.
results.text_hl: AIM: Emerging evidence has suggested that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ may be protective against the development of @<m>DISEASE_Papillomavirus_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D030361 @@@human-papillomavirus-related cancers@@@.

citations.NLM: Hsu AT, Hung YC, Fang SH, D'Adamo CR, Mavanur AA, Svoboda SM, Wolf JH. Metformin use and the risk of anal intraepithelial neoplasia in type II diabetic patients. Colorectal Dis. 2021 Dec;23(12):3220-3226. PMID: 34347359
